name: Privacy Payment Protocol
short_description: Credit/debit card payment transactions do not protect the privacy of the customer. Once the card is handed over to the merchant, customers are ‘‘no longer in control’’, leading to card fraud, identity theft, and customer profiling. Therefore, for those customers who value their privacy and security of their payment transactions, a choice — an alternate mobile payment model called ‘‘Pre-Paid Mobile HTTPS-based Payment model’’ is proposed. In here the customer obtains the merchant’s bank account information and then instructs his/her bank to transfer the money to the merchant’s bank account. Near field communication (NFC) protocol to obtain the merchant’s bank account information into the customer’s NFC-enabled smartphone. Partially blind signature scheme to hide the customers’ identity from the bank. As a result, this payment model provides the customer with complete control on his/her payments and privacy protection from both the bank and the merchant.
summary: Privacy-preserving mobile payment with customer in complete control
